I use white vinegar instead of fabric softener. My washer & dryer are fine. My clothes have not faded. They always smell fresh (and retain the freshness - like sheets, etc. that seldom get used). My clothes are very soft and don't attract lint. I've been doing this over 45 years. Works perfectly. Saves me TONS of money. Zoe "partnered with Downey"…of course they're going to say you NEED softener. Duh.
I have used one cup of white vinegar in the rinse for years. Especially on towels and whites- dryer sheets make towels less absorbent. Have done this for close to 55 years per Heloise in the 1960's
You can also take a piece of aluminum foil and scrunch it into a ball. Throw that in the dryer with your clothes & you won't have a problem with static.
You can experiment. Too much will leave a vinegar smell. Start out with about 1/4 cup or less for a large load. Throw about 1/4 cup in the dishwasher once a week or so, also.
I just fill the softener dispenser in my washer with vinegar instead of fabric softener. Another difference: fabric softener makes your towels LESS ABSORBENT whereas vinegar does not.

I live in an area of the country that has virtually no humidity. If I don't toss a dryer sheet into the dryer with my wash, the static electricity will be enough to light the entire state of, say, New York! I have found that fabric softener only clogs the washing machine after a while though and it then stop actually cleaning the clothes. Dryer sheets, however, are pretty much a necessity.

They keep the $ overseas because they made the $ overseas.  They already have to pay tax on the $ made overseas in the country it was made in. Sixty big U.S. companies analyzed by the Wall Street Journal kept on average more than 40 percent of their annual profits overseas last year. The companies have attributed a growing amount of their revenue to foreign sales, and they have assigned patents and licenses to foreign subsidiaries. Ted Cruz proposes a flat tax of 15% plus a 16% VAT. The main problem with that is he would exempt from all taxes dividends, capital gains, interest and estates. In other words every dime most of the 1% earn. The VAT tax is designed to make up the lost revenue from those at the top not paying anything.

Bob - Although Roth 401(k)s are subject to RMDs starting at age 70-1/2 the funds are not taxable when they come out.  Roth IRAs are not taxable and are not subject to RMDs.  Conventional 401(k) and IRA plans, on the other hand, are tax deductible when the money goes in and taxable when it comes out.  I fear that the alleged "fair tax" would make all of this pre-taxed Roth money taxable again when it is withdrawn.  That makes a "fair tax" extremely unfair.
That Public Sector Syndicate is a product of our democracy, so if you don't like that try a communist or dictatorial tyranny to live in and don't let the door hit you on the assce on the way our!
Keep your "fair" flat tax away from our Roth IRA and Roth 401(k) proceeds!  We paid income tax on this up front with the promise that it would not be taxable coming out.

She doesn't want this horrible life.  People who judge are uninformed.

These stories are why it is so important to be an active part in your children's lives.  Find out what they are doing, who they are hanging out with.  Do not try to be their friend...be their PARENT.  If they get mad at you...fine, if they say you are uncool...great.  At least you know they are safe.  Pay attention to your kids and give them the discipline they need, they will thank you in the long run for it.

Communication is the best way to deal in such situation. Making up multiple excuses why the flight didn't make it is airlines fault. Airlines companies try to schedule too many stops for one flight. Foreign airlines give you vouchers to make up for your inconvenience. I do not purchase travel insurance because I know my rights, insurance when purchasing with credit card.

The stylist shows you the swatches so that he/she can get an idea of the color you have in mind. Then, a good stylist will tell you whether that's a good color for you, why or why not, and make suggestions (lighter, darker, warmer, cooler). Simply saying you want 'blonde' can mean anything from nearly white to a medium shade of mud -- You won't be happy with the color if the stylist has no idea whether you meant white or mud when you said 'blonde'.

I use "pictures" of color. I find swatches aren't always realistic and very 2 dimensional where their examples are. I always felt swatches for the most part were for us stylists to use to make sure what color that particular number or code was meant to be. I'm not against doing it this way but I can see where some would feel like a deer in the headlights.

We show you swatches because people have very different concepts of what colors are. You can tell me you want red hair and in my mind I'm thinking of a natural auburn but you're thinking stop sign red. I've had women ask for platinum blonde, get platinum blonde and tell me it's not blonde at all.

If you have a very low taxable income for a few years between leaving work and starting SS/RMDs, doing some ROTH conversion is well worth considering.

j m Each person must decide how important peace of mind is to him and how prone he is to let modest risk nag at his feeling of well being. For someone who has assets and spending expectations that make it near certain there will be assets left for heirs and charities, annuities are a questionable investment. You are already well self-insured.

For some the annuity is for peace of mind more than returns and you can also do indexed annuities. Wife and I were in high stress positions and have assets. So we don't need to think about it we have multiple annuities and other secure income streams, other funds invested for heirs, charities and long term toys.

Skin-tone is continuous, and variations are based on where our ancestors migrated by latitude. Clinal variation is the similarity that occurs when limited genetic material is exchanged in a confined area (Mormons in Utah, for example)- this can produce "regional looks", but there are no "Types". Blacks and whites and others can miscegenate and transfuse blood, whereas sickle cell is a recessive trait.

The gene for sickle cell is carried by descendants of people who once lived in areas with high rates of malaria. This was mainly sub-Saharan Africa (dark skinned people) but also in central Europe (Belarus, light skinned people) where there is also a high rate of sickle cell. This is not specific to skin color.

AAPL hasn't done that well over the past few months. It is currently lagging QQQ.

Calvin, if Apple does not do well, QQQ will also not do well. You don't seem to understand what QQQ is. QQQ can NEVER do better than Apple. Why? Because 11% of QQQ is Apple and a larger percentage is dog techs like IBM, MSFT, INTC, etc.
Buy Apple for about $100.00 and sell it by the year end for 130.00, that's thirty percent upside in six months.

No thanks! I'll buy QQQ instead and get a decent rate of return without the huge downside risk. I've been very satisfied with having a split of QQQ and a half-dozen stocks carefully screened (for long-term growth) for my retirement portfolio. Trying to pick the flavor of the day might lead to some short-term spikes in growth but there are always the inevitable downside spikes as well. Unless you are a day trader it's just too risky to try and time the entry/exit points for that kind of stock.

You would have done much better if you bought and held Apple by itself. QQQ is very volatile and has a negative return because it includes a large number of dog tech stocks. The 11% AAPL it owns is where most of it's gains come from.

You can also take a piece of aluminum foil and scrunch it into a ball. Throw that in the dryer with your clothes & you won't have a problem with static.

I live in an area of the country that has virtually no humidity. If I don't toss a dryer sheet into the dryer with my wash, the static electricity will be enough to light the entire state of, say, New York! I have found that fabric softener only clogs the washing machine after a while though and it then stop actually cleaning the clothes. Dryer sheets, however, are pretty much a necessity.
I just fill the softener dispenser in my washer with vinegar instead of fabric softener. Another difference: fabric softener makes your towels LESS ABSORBENT whereas vinegar does not.
I have used one cup of white vinegar in the rinse for years. Especially on towels and whites- dryer sheets make towels less absorbent. Have done this for close to 55 years per Heloise in the 1960's
How much vinegar do you use for a load of clothes?
You can experiment. Too much will leave a vinegar smell. Start out with about 1/4 cup or less for a large load. Throw about 1/4 cup in the dishwasher once a week or so, also.

that one half of one percent of the national budget still equates to a larger dollar amount and hence an increase in budget.

There never has been any moon landing. These pictures were shot in a studio. If we had the technology to get there so many decades ago why is it that we have never returned even though NASA's budget has steadily and significantly increased?

During Apollo, NASA was getting approximately five percent of the national budget; since Apollo, NASA gets approximately one half of one percent of the national budget.

It turns out that the moon is a relatively dull place, and unless you have better plans than just going there, picking up a few rocks, and coming back, there is little incentive to go there. We will be going back to the moon, but as part of a broader plan, mainly to use it as a staging site to launch space craft to more interesting places.
